skillTree.localised_description: This loyal creature is as mighty and swift as a Great Eagle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
target_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: Making full use of the magic mists summoned by his mages, Aislinn is keen on leading shrewd surprise tactics against the enemy.

	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only the best on Aislinn's flagship, able to infiltrate, form up, kill everything and sail back in a fluent bloody motion.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 for Lothern Sea Guard, Lothern Swiftfeather Riders and Eagle Claw Bolt Throwers 
	(Lord's army)

Missile damage: +6% for Lothern Sea Guard, Lothern Swiftfeather Riders and Eagle Claw Bolt Throwers 
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: With typical Asur economy of motion and less common propensity for violence, Aislinn's longsword can cut a foe in twain even on a rocking boat. Not hypothetically.
Aislinn's narrow-eyed glares and short nods are an open book to his crews.
Aislinn's merciless actions are certainly effective if not exceedingly brutal and... diplomatically awkward. The politicking elven court has little appreciation for such disruption.
In these dangerous times, it's oddly comforting to know that there is someone with a propensity for brutal efficiency. The Phoenix King can make use of that.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

attributes.bullet_text: When this unit gets hurt it may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

skillTree.localised_description: The kindred of the storms for the Herald of Mathlann.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lore of Heavens spells
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

skillTree.localised_description: The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The fundamentals of the Lothern Navy has always been discipline and firepower. Never forget that. And magic. And dragons. But mostly discipline and firepower.

skillTree.localised_description: A dangerous and bloody business, but getting in stabbing distance with the enemy is as decisive as you can get.

skillTree.localised_description: The Asur may not like it to be reminded, but they can be as bloody-minded as their hated cousins when things get particularly... obsessive.

skillTree.localised_description: Oaths have been spoken, souls have been bound... And half of Ulthuan already sees the crew as lost elves walking. The other half would have been more careful with gods.

skillTree.localised_description: Once more onto the beach, my friends! Once more into the bloody waves!

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Things go a lot smoother when you are friendly with half of Lothern's nobility.
About time someone paid them back with their same medicine.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: For too long the domain of the seas has been neglected. By order of the Phoenix King, the best Sea Guards and Cothiquan mariners will make the Asur rule the waves again.

effects.description: Attrition: -33% casualties suffered from high seas attrition
Double experience gain for units when fighting at sea
Lord and Hero recruit rank: +3 for Lores of Shadows and Heavens spellcasters

items.colour_text: This rare suit of armour forged in ithilmar and sea gold is enchanted to protect the wearer and bears unusual prayers to Mathlann. Most elven smiths wouldn't normally dare, as the god is as fickle as the tides.
